text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1991, the CDTV is a home entertainment console by Commodore, aiming at being an all-in-one entertainment unit. It is essentially an Amiga 500 with a CD drive, remote control and joystick. Designed for use by non-technical users who still had an interest in its multimedia capabilities and interactivity. For example, the Grolier encyclopedia was one of its flagship titles. It was a commercial failure and less than one hundred titles were released (a large part already being ports from the Amiga 500).
